hanzi-su-wiki:
寛

Значения

Великодушный, снисходительный; отдыхать, расслабляться

Мнемоника

Искажено. Рогатое 艹 животное. Не агрессивно — могло бы боднуть, но не бодает. Сила его также — в глазах 目 и ногах 儿. Дом 宀 символизирует огромные пастбища обитания.

Варианты

寬, 宽

heisig_story: The house of flowers or "hothouse" has become a metaphor for a narrow-minded, biased, and intolerant attitude distrustful of change. Tolerance, in contrast, is open-minded and welcomes novelty. The way to encourage tolerance in those who lack it is first to have them see through their own hothouse attitudes, which is the very counsel we are given in this kanji.

［《廣韻》苦官切，平桓，溪。］
亦作“寛1”。“宽1”的繁体字。“完2”的今字。
(1)宽阔，广阔。
(2)度量宽宏；宽厚。
(3)宽免；宽恕。
(4)不严；宽大对待。
(5)舒缓；延缓。
(6)宽松；松弛。
(7)减轻。
(8)宽慰；宽解。
(9)卸脱；解开。
(10)多；宽裕。
(11)宽度。
(12)广泛。
(13)姓。汉有宽舒。见《汉书》本传。

Meaning Mnemonic
The roof flowers see everything. But, they only see. That is because they learned the art of tolerance.
These roof flowers only see because they do not judge. They accept everything. We humans can learn a thing or two about tolerance from these roof flowers.
Reading Mnemonic
Tolerance is one thing that Genghis Khan (かん) had a surprising amount of.
You wouldn't expect it, but he actually allowed many types of cultures, religions, and peoples to exist under his reign. The Mongols had an exceptional amount of tolerance for the time.
